required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Gene Therapy in Patients With Mucopolysaccharidosis Disease
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/II Open Label, Dose Escalation, Safety Study in Subjects With Mucopolysaccharidosis Type VI (MPS VI) Using Adeno-Associated Viral Vector 8 to Deliver the Human ARSB Gene to Liver

brief_summary.textblock: This study investigated the safety and efficacy of gene therapy approaches for Mucopolysaccharidosis type VI disease caused by the deficiency of arylsulfatase B (ARSB) enzyme. The aim of the study is to evaluate the safety and efficacy of the treatment.

detailed_description.textblock: Mucopolysaccharidosis type VI disease is involved in Lysosomal Storage Disorder. The MPS VI disease is characterized by growth retardation, corneal clouding, cardiac valve disease, organomegaly, skeletal dysplasia, without central nervous system involvement.

primary_outcome.measure: safety, vital signs, laboratory tests and liver ultrasound. signs, laboratory tests and liver ultrasound.
primary_outcome.description: Conditioning regimen-related safety through clinical evaluations recording the body temperature (Â°C), heart rate (bpm), blood pressure(mmHg), respiratory rate (bpm), complete physical exam

primary_outcome.measure: safety, laboratory tests and liver ultrasound.
primary_outcome.description: Inflammation of the liver, as shown by increase of transaminases (U/L) monitorated by laboratory test on serum samples of patients.

primary_outcome.measure: safety, laboratory test for kidney fuction
primary_outcome.description: kidney fuction monitoring by following parameters: creatinine(on serume mg/dL, on urine mg/24h), albumin(g/dL), total protein (on serum g/dL, on urine mg/24h) and BUN (on serum mg/dL, on urine g/24h)
monitoring of C3 and C4 protein of complement (g/dL)
evaluation of GAG (ug GAG/mg creatinine) excretion levels on urine collection of patients

secondary_outcome.description: Leukocyte ARSB levels (enzyme activity on leukocytes cells of patients U/g/h)

Endurance evaluation measured by 6-minute walk test (6MWT) and 3-minute stair climb test (3MSCT). These physiological parameter will be monitored by walking (meter/time)and climbing (number of small step climbed).

secondary_outcome.measure: efficacy, monitoring of physiological parameter by respiration
secondary_outcome.description: Forced vital capacity (FVC) and forced expiratory volume at 1(mL) minute (FEV1) in cooperative subjects

intervention.description: Adeno-associated viral vector serotype 8 with liver-specific thyroxinebinding globulin (TBG) promoter driving the expression of the human ARSB gene. Three dose levels are available: Starting dose is 6x1011 gc of vector per kg of body weight. High dose is 2x1012 gc of vector per kg of body weight and will be administered after at least two subjects at the starting dose have experienced no DLT Low dose is 2x1011 gc of vector per kg of body weight. Intermediate doses are also possible. The administration of the IMP will be performed into a peripheral vein. The IMP final volume to be injected is calculated based on the patient's weight (determined on the day of hospital admission), as 3 mL/kg.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects must have a documented biochemical and molecular diagnosis of MPS VI.
2. Subjects must be 4 years old or older.
3. Subjects should have received Enzyme Replacement Therapy (ERT) for at least 12 months before enrolment, and should continue to receive treatment until 7-14 days before IMP administration.
4. Documented informed consent; willingness to adhere to protocol and required long-term follow-up as evidenced by written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Subjects unable or unwilling to meet requirements of the study.
2. Participation in a clinical study with an investigational drug in the 6 months prior to enrolment in this trial.
3. Subjects who are unable to perform the 6MWT.
4. History of severe anaphylactoid reaction to Naglazyme in subjects receiving ERT that could affect the safety (severe reaction is meant to be an event with respiratory impairment that is life-threatening).
5. Presence of tracheostomy or need of ventilatory assistance.
6. Subjects with evidence of progressive severe myelomalacia that is predicted to require neck surgery in the first six months after enrolment.
7. Serum AST or ALT above the upper limit of normal range at the baseline evaluations (Baseline 2, -5 days).
8. Co-existence of chronic diseases or clinically relevant abnormal baseline laboratory values; infections with hepatitis B, C, or HIV (Baseline 1).
9. Systemic corticosteroid therapy or other immunosuppressive/immunomodulating drugs within 2 weeks prior to IMP administration.
10. Female individuals of childbearing age who are pregnant or nursing or unwilling to use effective contraception for at least one year post- IMP administration.
11. Fertile male individuals who are unwilling to use male barrier contraceptives such as condom.
12. Any other condition that would not allow the subject to complete follow-up examinations during the course of the study and that, in the opinion of the Investigator, would make the subject unsuitable for the study.
13. Detectable serum neutralizing antibodies (NAB) against AAV8 vector (Baseline 1).
